Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are given two event logs: Group A (Protected Group) and Group B (Unprotected Group). We need to compare and identify bias. The bias might be in favor of Group B (unprotected) because they get a Community Boost adjustment when they are part of a community group and are local residents. Meanwhile, Group A (protected) does not get any adjustment even though they might have similar preliminary scores.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Group A (Protected Group) - all cases have LocalResident = FALSE and CommunityGroup = None. No ScoreAdjustment. Decisions: P001 Approved (720), P002 Rejected (710), P003 Approved (740). So two approvals, one rejection. Group B (Unprotected Group) - all have LocalResident = TRUE. CommunityGroup: U001 and U003 are in Highland Civic Darts Club, U002 has None. They get ScoreAdjustment: when community group is not none, they get +10. Also note that in Group B, even when community group is none (U002), no adjustment. Decisions: U001 Approved (adjusted 730), U002 Rejected (710), U003 Approved (adjusted 705). So also two approvals, one rejection.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Compare: P001: preliminary 720, no adjustment, final 720, Approved. U001: preliminary 720, +10 adjustment, final 730, Approved. P002: preliminary 710, no adjustment, final 710, Rejected. U002: preliminary 710, no adjustment, final 710, Rejected. P003: preliminary 740, no adjustment, final 740, Approved. U003: preliminary 695, +10 adjustment, final 705, Approved.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: We see that U003 had preliminary 695, which is lower than any in Group A (lowest is 710 and 720). But after adjustment, it became 705, and it was approved. Meanwhile, Group A has no adjustments, so their scores are as is. But is there a threshold? We see that decisions: Approved when score >=720? P001:720 approved, P002:710 rejected, P003:740 approved. So seems threshold around 720? But U002:710 rejected, U001:730 approved, U003:705 approved.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: So U003 with adjusted score 705 got approved, but P002 with 710 got rejected. That suggests that the community boost allowed a lower preliminary score to be approved.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: ScoreAdjustment column: For U001 and U003: +10 (Community Boost) during PreliminaryScoring and carried forward. For U002: no adjustment. So it seems the boost is specifically for community group membership, not just local residency.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The protected group might be less likely to be in such community groups due to historical discrimination or segregation? Or maybe the community groups are only in certain neighborhoods that the protected group doesnt belong to? But in this data, Group A all have CommunityGroup=None, while Group B have some with community group. So there is a correlation: unprotected group more likely to have community group?

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group B all are local residents, Group A none are local residents. So maybe the system is biased because it rewards attributes that are more common in the unprotected group.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Perhaps the threshold is 720, then U003 705 should be rejected. Unless threshold is 700? But then P002 710 should be approved. Maybe the boost is applied twice? Or the rules engine has different thresholds for different groups?

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Maybe there is manual review that can override? But in the log, ManualReview activity doesnt show decision; decision is at FinalDecision by Rules Engine.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Thus, the bias is that the scoring system includes a Community Boost that is applied based on CommunityGroup membership, and since members of the protected group are less likely to be in such groups (or in this data, none are), they are disadvantaged.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In terms of decisions: without boost, a score of 710 leads to rejection (P002, U002). With boost, a preliminary score of 695 becomes 705 and gets approved (U003). That means the boost can make a difference of up to 10 points, and that can change a rejection to approval.
